comment.text:
I love my drink Ms.Chin made me, YUMMY..........
Waiting for food, place looks nice and friendly

photos.caption: I love my drink Ms.Chin made me, YUMMY!

comment.text:
I tried to order delivery and it was disastrous. The website said to expect a wait time of 90 minutes - 2 hours as it was a busy night. For some reason, I thought that was reasonable even though my home is precisely 0.6 miles / 3 minutes away according to Google Maps. 

After 2 hours and 10 minutes, I called and they said the kitchen is finishing up, it'll be 25-30 minutes, and the manager would consider giving me a discount. 40 minutes later, approaching the 3 hour mark since I ordered, I called and they had a difficult time even finding my order. I genuinely don't think they even received it or were making it, meaning the previous employee made up what they told me. On the second call, I told them to cancel the whole thing and refund me as my family was hungry. I got no apology for their sloppiness. I enjoy their food but will not be returning. 

Completely disorganized and 0 customer service or desire to correct their errors.

Best Chinese restaurant in Atlanta hands down. Mrs. Chen, the owner, is a treasure and the food is always on point. The beautiful setting and decor is a bonus. We've been coming for years and it's still the best around.

They are fairly pricey however if the food was fabulous I could look pass that. I ordered the Sweet and Sour Chicken and my question is how in the world did they give me burnt fortune cookies? I was hungry so I eat my expensive meal for dinner. Then around 3 am in the morning, I was awaken by an upset stomach. Unless you are looking for a laxative, do not order the chicken.
Excellent energy! Drinks and food were amazing! Great menu with lots of options. Very large sushi menu with lots of variety

photos.caption: Best Mai tai I've ever had! Very fresh mint

comment.text:
We were greeted by the hostess that brought us the our table. The restaurant was moderately busy so there was not a long wait. Our server was friendly and efficient. We ordered sushi which was very tasty and more than enough for 2 people to share. I ordered miso soup which was nice and light and had mushrooms in the soup as well. 

My entree was very healthy and full of flavor. The vegetables were cooked nicely and the shrimp were large and cooked perfectly.
Nice clean restaurant . The  food was good and the  prices go in hand with the portions. The general tso's chicken was really good.

Stopped in for a late lunch with my husband.

We were the only customers at 3pm with the exception of a take out order at the bar.

Service was great & the food was excellent!

My husband had the Mongolian Beef and I had the Hunan Pork, we both had e egg drop soup.

Yum!
We will be back!!:)
Excellent food and drinks. Highly recommend! Very diverse menu, good atmosphere, staff very friendly.
The service was great. The food was wonderful. I throughly enjoyed this restaurant. The Chicken Fried Rice was fresh. Sweet and Sour Chicken was fresh as  well! Ten out of ten!
Excellent Sushi as well as drinks. Had a great tasting pina colada. Service was great as well.
Foods great, excellent service and tasty drinks. Ms. Chin is the sweetest! Best Chinese in Atlanta by far.
This restaurant is great!!! Good hot food, nice drinks,  and outstanding customer service

Second time we ordered and found hair in our food. I'm better than going back a third time. 

Really sucks that cleanliness is an issue because the flavor is on point.
ABSOLUTELY the best place to dine and have amazing drinks. Always made with love. I will continue to return. You must try it out!

Wanted to take my husband on a date and he wanted Chinese. This was our second choice and I'm so glad we chose Grand China! Food and drinks were amazing! My husband had a delicious raspberry martini. I have strawberries daiquiri both were very flavorful! I also had chicken fried rice that was the best I had in a long time! I love the decor and how the table was set. Very intimate and warm. Service was amazing and they were so nice and kind. We can not wait to return. Favorite spot. Benihana who???

Upon walking into the Grand China restaurant for lunch, you see a unused bar (perhaps they only use it for dinner service). I was sat quickly and asked my preference on where I wanted to sit. The place smells like a musty bar, no scent of Chinese food when you walk in the door. I was greeted by the waitress and asked what I'd like to drink, I ordered the Japanese green tea. I order the Hunan beef with brown rice, after noticing that the usual Chinese items I would usually order are not on the lunch menu. I also ordered the wonton soup that is included with the meal. The soup was luke warm, the broth was tasty but the wontons were unusually thick and doughy and I had a hard time finding the meat. When my entree arrived, I immediately noticed, I did not get the brown rice I ordered but decided not to say anything as the waitress seemed busy. The dish itself again was just warm, not hot and some of the veggies were cold. The flavor was pretty bland, hardly any spice at all. Overall, I would not come back. I will give them points for playing Christmas music though.

This lychee martini is a MUST Try! I Order lychee martini's everywhere I go. When it came to the table I was suspect due to the color BUT it was out of this world! BTW the food is always amazing every time I come here, never disappoints.
Best Drink and food on Piedmont ask for Mrs. Ching she will make the experience great to top it off

I really was looking forward to this, adorable ambience, beautiful dish, but looks are deceiving. I had the spicy Thai shrimp and was expecting something more then shrimp and vegys in extremely salty soy sauce, while the shrimp and vegys were nice and fresh, saltiness and lack of any other flavor was very disappointing.  Husband had Spicy Thai beef and vegys and was not impressed, Much more salty than spicy. The drink prices were outrageous as well $13 and up.  We stuck with beer and wine, $11 for Kendall Jackson Chardonnay, felt like we were in NY or Miami.  With that said next time we are in town I would give it a second chance, the menu is huge and I will try something else.
Best drinks in town! Food is immaculate! I love coming to this place. Owner and staff is very kind and welcoming!

photos.caption: Virgin mai tai and frozen pineapple rum daiquiri!

comment.text: Very awesome atmosphere and DRINKS!!!! The customer service is impeccable and the owner is VERY welcoming! I have driven by this place for many years, and finally stopped by. This is my new spot for drinks and Chinese food. Hidden Gem... for me at least..lol But seriously, a great place overall!

First dining experience here was Dec.26. We had reservations for a table for 11 and were seated promptly after arrival...at a table for 10. But we had several kids and managed to squeeze an extra chair in. Waitress was very friendly and engaging and got our orders right away. I will comment that the menus were lacking - none of the Japanese items seen online were there. We were able to order some anyway (sushi chef out sick) but only because we looked in advance. It went downhill from there. 20mins for drinks. Another 10-15 for soup to arrive. Entrees came thereafter, scattered every 10-15mins. Then we waited for the check...I had to go ask for it twice. The food was great, and I realize it was day after holiday, but they were really suffering lack of staff. You have to shut off the delivery orders when the kitchen backs up and that didn't happen. Other tables waited and hour and got no food, leaving angrily and loudly. I would eat again with a normal party size on a normal night, but this was a huge failure in staffing.
Very disappointing from the begin,we called ahead to make sure there was a table for us. However they had no record of our reservation. Service was slow and poor. Food was okay . Would not recommend.

I love this place! Literally has the best bartender in town her name is Chang!! The strawberry margaritas are to die for! (Better than the margs I once had in Puerto Rico) YESSS I COULDN'T BELIEVE IT EITHER!  Whenever I am down or having a bad day I take myself out to eat! The vibes here are an instant reset & I leave feeling super recharged! The staff is so sweet & the food is super fresh & tasty! I recommend the General Tso's chicken and California roll sushi! I am so blessed I found this place! A God sent for my mental

photos.caption: Frozen strawberry Marg & General Tso's chicken with white rice

comment.text: This establishment is worth going too. The owner is amazing she is top tier of a beautiful woman! Everything is worth trying especially the Key Lime Martini

"What is happening? Everybody's supposed to be eating Chinese food." -- The Big Bang Theory: Season 11 | Episode 19

I grew up coming to Grand China as a kid, not often, but often enough. I won't talk about just how long that has been, but let's just saw that this place is almost as old as I am...

I brought my friends and neighbors here as they were craving quality Chinese food - they wanted a buffet. I explained that isn't usually quality. But if they wanted the good stuff, the best was in our back yard. We were quickly seated and our serve came by immediately. He was very attentive and made sure our drinks were never below half full.

We ordered a ton of food - so much, in fact, the server commented that we had ordered plenty. Never say this to a table - think wisely. We would have ordered more. Think leftovers! We started with the Egg Drop Soup and Steamed Veggie Dumplings - both winners and both evoked memories from my childhood. Everything came our hot and delicious.

As for entries, we had a hard time deciding. We opted for a variety of dishes and our server was good about letting me know what was safe for me to eat. Turns out everything was safe for my allergies. We chose:
Mu shu pork
Sliced roast pork
General Tso's chicken
Beef ho fin
Ginger fried chicken

The guys decided on no seafood since I was at the table, even though I insisted it was fine. They decided we had picked enough stuff to enjoy. I will say that the Mu Shu was my Dad's favorite and I feel like it has not changed a bit. Building up those pancakes made me feel like a kid again. The two chicken dishes were both packed with flavor and really hit the spot, but I think thee beef was my favorite of the day - we didn't have any left to take home.

We packed up the rest of the leftovers, which was not too much, and were full and happy. Always a fabulous meal and glad to have them so close to home.

My wife and I had heard great things about Grand China Restaurant, and we were not disappointed! We happened the be driving by today and decided to pop in and give it a try.  The interior is very simply and very well decorated.  Lots of cool features and natural light.  The customer service was excellent.  Our waitress was fantastic and Ms. Chan came by multiple times to make sure that we were happy with the food and the drink.  She is responsible for all the recipes on the menu, both food and drink, and she was a delight to speak with as well.  My wife and I split the Szechuan soup dumplings, the saut√©ed boc choy, and the roasted duck.  I would highly recommend all three! Additionally, my wife got a pina colada, and was very impressed.  We will definitely be returning.  Be sure to check this place out!

This is the most magical restaurant, as soon as I entered I could feel how soft and wonderful the atmosphere was, ive never felt so comfortable in a public place ever as I did there ! Our server and the owner of Grand China, the beautiful mrs. Cheng is the loveliest, sweetest and passionate lady I have ever met ! She is full of love and light, she cares so much for her customers and making people happy! the food is some of the best I've had (^_^) so authentic and perfectly prepared! Mrs. Cheng is the best ! 10000000000000/10 recommend !

-Alula m.m :)

Grand China is always on point. Food is always great!!
Even enjoyed a Mai Tai - best ever!

Top notch. The best Chinese restaurant we have been to in atleast 30 years. The owner is super intelligent, and amiable.  She has created the best experience. The food we ordered was meticulously prepared and delicious. The ambiance excellent,  and the service was delightful.  If there was a way to give them 10 stars I would.
best bartender in the world. food and everything was really good. everyone was very friendly
Amazing service and even better food and drink.  I had the mango daiquiri and the Boston roll.
Great restaurant with great, tasty food! I drive by this place all the time but every time I stop to eat here I'm pleasantly surprised. Try Mrs. Chen's awesome Pina Colada!

Dinner here is amazing and an astounding experience both for the palate and the ambiance. Tonight we started with cocktails of which were a dirt martini and a raspberry martini (fresh muddled raspberries). Next, we had hot and sour soup, chicken egg rolls and steamed pork dumplings. The main course was chicken lo mein and Old Chinese Favor Calamari.  If you have been here, you know the experience I am talking about; however, if you have not been here, you are most definitely missing out on a grand dining experience.

photos.caption: Old Chinese Favor Calamari and chicken lo mein

comment.text: The food probably would've been good however we just waited 15 mins for service and the only thing the server said was "drink?" Like what ....we left I can't with Atlanta service probably why the owner was not worrying about us leaving....horrible !! He didn't even ask why were leaving, as an industry worker this is why people don't eat out.

Great food. 
Drink is the best I have had.
I travel a lot and eat and drink as well. BBQ Pork BunsPepper SteakShrimp Fried Rice.
They have the best Southern Hospitality.

I don't know what the people who wrote these other reviews are smoking. I'll never use this one again. The food was inedible. Not a single piece of breaded and fried, orange chicken was acceptable. Every bite was gristle. The pork egg foo young was cold at pickup and the rice was not cooked long enough. $30+ down the drain.

Free and ample parking!  The owner was immediately visible sitting at the first table.  That's a great sign that there's 'adult supervision.'  The smell was excellent upon entering.  A general good/happy vibe in the dining room.  The wait staff was superb - our water glasses were never less than half full!  This was my first ever visit - and I did my research.  I had been watching YouTube videos on Asian cooking - and was dying for wok prepared entrees. We had the fried pork dumplings and sizzling rice soup as our appetizers.  The fried dumplings were not the best I've had.  Certainly not terrible - just a little doughy and the pork filling wasn't my favorite.   But the sizzling rice soup was very good.  The House Fried Rice was excellent.  But the General Tso's Chicken (requested extra spicy) was the best I've ever had!  When you have breaded chicken at an average Chinese restaurant - it never really tastes right.  A truly experienced chef and a blazingly hot wok are indispensable.  My General Tso's chicken arrived piping hot!  The white rice was fresh and hot and sticky - just like you'd expect from a premier Chinese restaurant.  They were incredibly generous with the sauce.  The sauce was incredibly sweet but that flavor was cut with vinegar and spiciness.  But the key was the breading!  The breading was perfectly crispy - which is make or break for Chinese cuisine. This dish brought back memories (I didn't know I had).  I can assure you I'll be back.  This is a world class Chinese restaurant with very talented chefs who make entrees with love.  I wish I could go in the kitchen and watch them cook for 60-minutes to get ideas for the next entree I want to try!

Being shut in for over 2 weeks, we decided to treat ourselves to take out. We LOVE Grand China, no naturally we ordered here. It was ready when promised and when we got it home, it was as fresh as if we were dining in! 
Thank you!
Sushi was incredible! Would give it 5 stars but the shrimp Rice wasn't up to par but not completely horrible.

We ordered take out. Fried dumplings, General Tso Chicken, Veg Fried Rices and Tom Kha soup. The crispy wontons that came with the soup were the best part. Veg  fried rice was mushy, salty, no discernible flavor. Very small veg pieces. General Tso's chicken was bland, sweet, fatty, heavily breaded. The Tom Kha soup did not have any flavor. More like salty water. No lemon grass. No coconut. No cilantro. Lots of mushrooms and over boiled chicken. The dumplings were gummy and just bad. This was the worst Chinese I've had in Atlanta. That's says a lot given that there are so few good Chinese restaurants in town.
Food was great! The mojito was so good! Nice atmosphere & friendly staff. Thank you Mrs. Chang!
Very nice waitstaff & bartender... We had the General's TSO chicken, It was really good. The shrimp fried rice was also good. I didn't really like Lo mein. Very good drinks and atmosphere.

This is an Atlanta institution serving their customers since 1978. They are open for Dine In so please come and support them. We had the Mongolian Beef and it was the best we have ever tasted! The beef was tender and the sauce wasn't too sweet. My wife had a Cosmopolitan and she loved it!

photos.caption: Mongolian Beef is out of this world!!!
The Cosmopolitan is fantastic and refreshing! Dine in and help this restaurant that has served Atlanta since 1978! The owners are so fun!

comment.text: The food here is excellent and the customer service is even better. Parking lot is kind of tight but I like the house cozy feel it gives...
Very slow service. They ignored us for about 10 minutes. Great soup. I would return again to give them a second chance.

I really enjoyed my experience here! Mrs. Chan was the highlight of my visit. She was everything! She had great recommendations... the Mai Tai is a MUST! I'm vegan & she recommended this delicious veggie soup. My partner had the general tso & loved every bit. We'll definitely be back!!
Drinks are veryyyyyy good. The lady making the drinks was nice and friendly. Variety of drinks to choose from. Will update the food review.
This restaurant is awesome. The sushi is great. The drinks are fabulous. Fresh fruits and organic foods are the bombs.
